data.title: The Southland Tribune; Edition #33
data.meta_description: One term and out: Mager reflects on council frustrations/Special moment as 'Inverkelly's' past and future come together/Is Southland home to the country's best excavator driver?
data.text:
One term and out: Mager reflects on council frustrations

Special moment as 'Inverkelly's' past and future come together

Is Southland home to the country's best excavator driver?

Disappointing numbers, exceedingly high performances

Today’s Poll…. Where are you going for a drink?

Why Southland is a gem…. Reason #31 (ILT Stadium Southland)

Out & About… NZ Super Trucks

Plus, Tribune Shoutout, our Quick Quiz and more

One term and out: Mager reflects on council frustrations

In 2019 Bonnie Mager decided to stand as a councillor for Environment Southland. She was successful, and somewhat bucked the trend. Mager was one of just two females elected and was 19 years younger than the next youngest councillor at the table. But she quickly became frustrated. [READ MORE HERE].

Special moment as 'Inverkelly's' past and future come together

John Kelly’s key part in Invercargill’s historical story will forever be remembered as people tuck into their pizza or ponder what movie they might want to watch at the location where 166 years ago Kelly set up home as the first European settler in the area. (READ MORE HERE).

Is Southland home to the country's best excavator driver?

Invercargill local Brendon Ferguson will have his, and his excavator’s, mettle tested in Feilding later this week when he shows off his skills in a 13-tonne digger to represent Southland at the National Excavator Operator Competition. (READ MORE HERE).

Disappointing numbers, exceedingly high performances

Sprint sensation Cody Lawson (SBHS) again showcased his abilities at the Southland Secondary School Athletics Championships. His 100, 200 and 400 were the fastest of all grades at the championships. Lawson was one of many impressive performances at a championships event where the number of participants was low. (READ MORE HERE).

Join as a paid supporter/subscriber….

We are a reader-supported platform, so please consider joining The Tribune as a paid subscriber/supporter to help us continue to produce more Southland content like this. You will also get access to all the paid subscriber-only content we produce in the future.

Quick Quiz….

1. Rowena Jackson has a retirement village named after her, what was she famous for?

2. Who is the Gore Mayor?

3. In which occupation did former Invercargill resident Peter Arnett make a name for himself?

4. What is the name of the event that has attracted some of the world's biggest names in BMX and free-style motocross to an Otapiri Gorge farm?

5. Which Southern Steel player brought up game No 200 of elite netball on Saturday night?

(SCROLL TO BOTTOM FOR ANSWERS)

Today’s Poll…

Out & About….

Southern Thunder race meeting - Saturday & Sunday (March 18, March 19)

A big field of NZ Super Trucks is part of the programme for the Southern Thunder race meeting at Teretonga Park in Invercargill this weekend.

The New Zealand Super Trucks will fight out Round 3 of their National Championship at Teretonga Park.

Leading the way will be the current champion, Alex Little of Upper Hutt in his Freightliner 3 Series. Little became the youngest driver to ever win the Super Truck title last year and leads this year’s standings after two of four rounds.

The other feature class will be the Mobil 1 Mainland Muscle Cars. The programme will also feature the New Zealand Formula Ford Championship and the South Island F1600 Championship, Pre 65 Saloons, NZ Six Saloons and the Noel McIntyre Drainage Club Saloons.

Pre-sale weekend passes costing just $35 (plus any applicable admin charges) are available from Auto Centre, Tweed Street, Invercargill, E Hayes & Sons, Dee

Street, Invercargill, Harrisons Supplies, Mersey Street, Gore while weekend passes at the gate are $45 each while day passes are $25 per day. Children 14 & under accompanied by an adult free.

Why Southland is a gem…. Reason #33

(We think it’s worth reminding ourselves why Southland is such a special place, so that’s what we’ll do regularly)

ILT Stadium Southland. It’s the heart of the community which started off as sports venue but is now home to almost everything you can think of.

It was originally opened in 2000 and rebuilt in 2014 to the tune of $41 million.

The venue is multipurpose and capable of hosting a wide range of events including conferences, exhibitions and trade shows.

A diverse range of internationally-acclaimed shows – from Hi 5 to Billy Connolly – have performed in the venue, which has also hosted numerous national and provincial events, including craft shows, boat shows, exhibitions and trade shows as well as high profile events such as a gala dinner with Nigella and the Joseph Parker - Road to the Title fight.

The facility incorporates the SIT Zero Fees Velodrome, which opened in 2006 as New Zealand's first indoor velodrome.

Southland is the envy of many other provincial region given it has such a venue to utilise.

Gift a subscription…..

Is there someone who you think might quite like The Southland Tribune and might enjoy coming on board? How about gifting them a subscription? It’ll be a nice gesture, will ensure that person will get access to our paid subscriber-only content, and will help support the Tribune in its quest to tell more Southland stories.

Give a gift subscription

In case you missed it….

Steel struggles: If there were any doubts a season without star shooter George Fisher was going to be a massive mountain to climb for the Southern Steel, it’s plain for all to see now. Can the Steel rebound against the Northern Stars in Auckland tonight [Monday]? READ MORE HERE).

The n-word: Invercargill Mayor Nobby Clark says since his controversial use of the “n-word” hit national headlines, he has received over 100 emails and 90 to 95% he says are in support of his point. Although you also don’t have to look too far to find plenty of people who have condemned it and are fed up with Clark. (READ MORE HERE).
